Miscellaneous

Here are a number of web development tools that I've found useful, but they don't really fit anywhere else.

Markdown Cheatsheet

Visit

Markdown is a lightweight formatting language for formatting. Markdown is incredibly useful for writing documentation, Github readmes and even static websites. It is also frequently used on forums, including Reddit. Here's a website with all of your formatting needs. It comes complete with code and examples.

Markdown Live Preview

Visit

Sometimes it's hard to predict if your Markdown looks right. Sometimes your text editor doesn't have a live preview option. If so, this tool will let you see how your Markdown looks.

Lorem Ipsum

Visit

Lorem Ipsum is a valuable tool for typography and testing layouts. Lorem Ipsum generates random text in latin that you can use to help layout or plan your website or any other work requiring text.

Balsamiq

Visit

Balsamiq is a rapid wireframing tool that enables you to create mock ups for websites, mobile apps and software. Available for a 30 day free trial, Balsamiq does cost a hefty $89.00

Sketch

Visit

Sketch is a tool for designing your web and mobile apps, from the initial plans to the final assets. It enables you to get ready to build the real thing.

Regexr

Visit

RegEx is one of the most confusing aspects of programming. Regexr is a tool that helps alleviate some of that pain, providing a cheatsheet for RegEx symbols and a live editor that allows you to see what exactly your RegEx is targeting.
